/why-accessability.html.title: Why Accessability
/why-accessability.html.content:
this section covers why accessibility important therefore have policy your institution

use this : help educate others about benefits implementing policy advocating administrators

/accessability-is-important.html.title: Accessability is Important
/accessability-is-important.html.content:
accessibility work improves access everyone by removing barriers important many reasons:

  • ’s law!  w3c web page < href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://wwww3org/wai/policies/&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798265808&usg=aovvaw38b8wluq_q2higrgjgqk" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">web accessibility laws & policies includes relevant country including united states href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://wwww3org/wai/policies/unitedstates/#americanswithdisabilitiesact1990adaamended&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798266351&usg=aovvaw2fryntim23fgd5ylrb4ycn" noreferrer">americans with disabilities act 1990  href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://wwww3org/wai/policies/unitedstates/#section508usrehabilitationact1973amended&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798266644&usg=aovvaw02cgdcm901mcdw8kbpdcwo" noreferrer">section 508 us rehabilitation 1973 read href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://dredforg/2021/12/16/payanvlaccdexplainer/&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798266873&usg=aovvaw1mvthbent87bepkyum54js" noreferrer">payan v laccd explainer  greater understanding
  • minimizes risk may minimize legal risk < href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://wwww3org/wai/businesscase/&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798267315&usg=aovvaw1cntz6p5bwpmbj747hengm" noreferrer">business case digital accessibility  well operational risks
  • benefits everyone while still remaining focused users disabilities learn more href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://wwww3org/wai/media/av/usersorgs/&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798267734&usg=aovvaw2jdxmzuesirdylumrv1yjl" noreferrer">user experiences organizations
  • increases usage materials patron base href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://wwww3org/wai/media/av/usersorgs/&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798268163&usg=aovvaw1frh_zeintrllwecz0d1l" builds healthy institutional culture belonging continued improvement  validates individual efforts allowing them succeed having organization commitment codified policy
  • ’s right thing ; accessibility humanrights  cause
disability prevalent than some might think:

  • 27%  adults live type disability (< href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://wwwcdcgov/ncbddd/disabilityandhealth/documents/disabilities_impacts_all_of_uspdf&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798269033&usg=aovvaw0hjyfbtvdjp2tlaefsr76s" noreferrer">cdc 2023)
  • 19%  undergraduate students reported 2015/16 href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://ncesedgov/fastfacts/displayaspid=60&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798269576&usg=aovvaw1pf8ejb5gqixo7jnznk9nc" noreferrer">nces)
  • 48%  reported having  have had diagnosed mental health condition 2020 href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://boyntonumnedu/surveys&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798270074&usg=aovvaw2z_1f4pcmooqkgtxu3eua5" noreferrer">boynton survey)
  • 100%  people will experience point  their life according href="https://wwwgooglecom/urlq=https://axesslabcom/statisticsdisabilities/&sa=d&source=editors&ust=1694718798270559&usg=aovvaw3ynknpahntyca5nyhvdrw0" noreferrer">axess lab
while should remain that way disability because can :

  • permanent something go away over time (such turner syndrome);
  • temporary such injury eventually heal;
  • situational example when someone forgets glasses they situations have visual impairment
impairments also physical cognitive emotional whether:

  • invisible hearing loss cognitive dyslexia
  • visible using mobility device

/accessability-as-success.html.title: Access as Success
/accessability-as-success.html.content:
access heart accessibility access underlies success (< href="https://uspirgedfundorg/sites/pirg/files/reports/fixing broken textbook market 3e february 2021pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">nagle & vitez 2021) our users can’t information content they need ways will accomplish what wanted

< href="https://wwwunorg/development/desa/disabilities/conventionrightspersonswithdisabilities/conventionbriefhtml" noreferrer">un convention rights persons with disabilities united nations calls upon countries “promote by providing intended general public accessible formats technologies (article 21)” designing your digital materials accessibility mind helps meet fundamental right among much broader population

/accessability-vs-accomodation.html.title: Accessibility vs. Accommodation
/accessability-vs-accomodation.html.content:
don’t make content services accessible only when someone asks that creates barrier inclusive access can discourage users from making request creating with accessibility mind fosters environment all users u states < href="https://accessibilityumnedu/node/801" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">accessibility proactive; accommodation reactive where

  • accessibility = equal everyone by design

  • accommodation additional support needs have been met

make choices now accommodations more quickly cheaply effectively future

/accessability-benefits-everyone.html.title: Accessibility Benefits Everyone
/accessability-benefits-everyone.html.content:
increasing accessibility benefits everyone end while certain features are designed people with disabilities many other folks also find them helpful accessible u notes that < href="https://accessibilityumnedu/importanceaccessibility/benefitsaccessibledesign" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">benefits design can help:

  • people developing their english language skills;

  • people using older technologies access internet;

  • people very loud quiet environments where speech difficult impossible understand;

  • people mobile devices: href="https://wwwpewresearchorg/internet/factsheet/mobile/" noreferrer">pew research centerreported that 2021 28 percent aged 1829 depend smart phones online access 15 americans rely devices only form high speed internet access

/accessability-is-the-foundation-of-usab.title: Accessibility is the Foundation of Usability
/accessability-is-the-foundation-of-usab.content:
< href="http://wwwisoorg/iso/catalogue_detailhtmcsnumber=16883" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">iso924111 defines usability :

“extent which product can used by specified users achieve goals effectively efficiently with satisfaction context use”

broadly speaking accessibility work supports all people critical those who have impairments improves access information instance captions videos are without hearing impairments multitude reasons such needing sound low facilitating memory retention understanding unclear parts how words spelled learning language web initiative (wai) describes < href="https://wwww3org/wai/fundamentals/accessibilityusabilityinclusion/#accessibleusable" noreferrer">how usabilityoverlap

/the-case-for-digital-accessibility.html.title: The Case for Digital Accessibility
/the-case-for-digital-accessibility.html.content:
web accessibility initiative (wai) outlined < href="https://wwww3org/wai/businesscase/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> business casefor digital accessibility
which includes how may:

  • < href="https://wwww3org/wai/businesscase/#driveinnovation" noreferrer">drive innovation;

  • < href="https://wwww3org/wai/businesscase/#enhanceyourbrand" noreferrer">enhance your brand;

  • < href="https://wwww3org/wai/businesscase/#increasemarketreach" noreferrer">increase market reach;

  • < href="https://wwww3org/wai/businesscase/#minimizelegalrisk" noreferrer">minimize legal risk

their case outlines how:

  • accessible content ranked higher search results

  • accessible documents transcripts can searched by individuals automated systems such engines

  • flexible designs ensure access with diverse abilities learning styles devices

  • diversity that experiences people disabilities creates more vibrant rigorous community enriching research scholarship

/rethinking-ability-and-disability.html.title: Rethinking Ability and Disability
/rethinking-ability-and-disability.html.content:
jay dolmage’s book < href="https://quodlibumichedu/u/ump/mpub9708722/1:4/academicableismdisabilityhighereducationrgn=div1;view=fulltext" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">academic ableism provides some definitions consider:

disablism" can defined “ set assumptions (conscious unconscious) practices that promote differential unequal treatment people because actual presumed disabilities” (kumari campbell 4) disablism short negatively constructs disability disablism both values material circumstances around with disabilities says there could nothing worse than being disabled treats disabled unfairly result these values ableism other hand instead situating disability bad focusing stigma positively able­bodiedness fact ableism makes able­bodiedness able­mindedness compulsory negative quite directly literally renders abject invisible disposable less human while represented once ideal normal mean default

when thinking all different abilities engaging digital content focus social model traditionally view through what referred medical model which:

  • defines something needs cured fixed;

  • focuses problem resides within individual

when about work done reduce remove barriers abilities using disability:

  • focuses how society does allow impairment disable person impairment;

  • defines environment addressing content accessibility mindset use disability

/writing-an-accessability-policy.html.title: Writing an Accessibility Policy
/writing-an-accessability-policy.html.content:
use this section : develop accessibility policy

web initiative (wai) excellent resources with detailed guidelines developing policies following subsections refer basic policy structure:

  • < href="https://wwww3org/wai/planning/orgpolicies/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">developing organizational policies accessibility

  • < href="https://wwww3org/wai/planning/statements/" statement
